alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 144 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
